intro: Machaerium nuanucoense, commonly known as the Nuanuco grass, is a species of flowering plant native to South America, particularly in regions of Peru and Bolivia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its upright growth habit and feathery foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale purple, often blooming during the dry season. Machaerium nuanucoense is adapted to grow in dry, rocky soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats.
